question_sentence: Starbucks reintroduced one of its most popular drinks this week, commonly known as the “PSL.” What does “PSL” stand for?
evidence: Starbucks’ beloved Pumpkin Spice Latte is back – and at a slightly higher price. The PSL, as it’s often referred to, has been a popular item on Starbucks’ menu for nearly two decades, eliciting excitement among its loyal fan base.

question_sentence: Which state’s capital city is facing a water crisis after one of its water treatment plants failed?
evidence: The governor of Mississippi declared a state of emergency for Jackson, the state’s largest city, after its main water treatment facility failed, leaving residents without enough water to flush toilets or fight fires.

question_sentence: Which popular tourist destination was designated a “gun-free zone” this week?
evidence: People who carry firearms in Times Square’s new “gun-free zone” could be charged with a felony under a law that went into effect this week.

question_sentence: A Mickey Mantle baseball card from 1952 recently sold at auction for a jaw-dropping price, making it the most valuable sports collectible in the world. How much did the card sell for?
evidence: The baseball card sold for $12.6 million. Mantle spent 17 years playing for the New York Yankees and was inducted into the Baseball Hall of Fame in 1974. The card is especially valuable because it’s so well-preserved, according to Heritage Auctions.

question_sentence: In a recent major drug bust near the Texas-Mexico border, authorities seized more than $11 million worth of cocaine disguised as which household product?
evidence: An inspection near Laredo, Texas, revealed nearly 2,000 packages of baby wipes stuffed with more than 1,500 pounds of alleged cocaine.

question_sentence: Due to pressure from the Biden administration, what are some major airlines now offering to passengers when their flights are canceled?
evidence: Several major US airlines updated their customer service agreements this week to offer hotels and meals when flights are canceled. American Airlines, Delta Air Lines, United Airlines, JetBlue and Southwest have all published updates to their customer service policies this week.

question_sentence: Tennis star Serena Williams began what could be her final act this week by playing in which tournament?
evidence: Williams has been competing in thrilling matches at the US Open this week – reminding the world why she is one of the greatest tennis players of all time. She previously said these may be the final days of her storied career.

question_sentence: What percentage of the total US population is vaccinated against Covid-19?
evidence: About two-thirds of the total US population is vaccinated against Covid-19 with an initial series, according to data from the CDC. But less than half of those with their initial series – and less than a third of the total population – has also gotten a booster.

question_sentence: NASA was forced to reschedule its historic Artemis I launch on Monday due to a series of complications. Where is the mega rocket’s launchpad located?
evidence: The uncrewed Artemis I mission will get another attempt at launching on a journey around the moon on Saturday from Launchpad 39B at Kennedy Space Center in Florida.

question_sentence: According to a new estimate out this week, approximately how much does it cost to raise a child to the age of 17?
evidence: Thanks to inflation, it now costs more than $300,000 for a married middle-income couple with two children to raise their youngest child from birth through high school, according to a recent estimate from the Brookings Institution.

question_sentence: Serena Williams pulled off an upset of the No. 2 seed in the second round of the U.S. Open. Who did she defeat?
Who won artist of the year at Sunday’s MTV Video Music Awards?
Who was voted No. 1 in the “Top 100 players of 2022” by his peers in the NFL?
An extraordinary Justice Department court filing this week included a photograph that showed what on the floor of Mar-a-Lago?
An internet, TV, phone and energy company in Tennessee is launching an internet service the company says is how fast?
After 26 years alone, the last person to live in Brazil's Tanaru Indigenous Territory died this week. He was known as:
Twitter announced this week that it will be testing which new feature?
choices: A daily alert to tweet at a random time

question_sentence: NASA's Artemis I launch was scrubbed this week over last-minute issues. Where was the rocket headed?
Even if the entire world stopped burning fossil fuels today, a new study says global sea levels will rise nearly a foot because of:
A Nebraska man claimed the world record for the "longest journey by a pumpkin boat" by paddling a 846-pound floating pumpkin down a river for:
Which Nobel Peace Prize-winning former world leader died this week, aged 91?
evidence: Awarded the prize in 1990 for his role in ending the Cold War, the last leader of the Soviet Union remained a divisive figure in Russia. He died in Moscow after a long illness.

question_sentence: What is the name of the new daily news podcast launched by former BBC stars Emily Maitlis, Jon Sopel and Lewis Goodall?
evidence: The new show was launched by BBC rival Global earlier this week.

question_sentence: How many UK workers from minority ethnic backgrounds have quit their jobs because of racism, according to a new survey?
evidence: According to a TUC survey of the UK’s 3.9m minority ethnic workers, more than one in four  said they had faced racist jokes at work in the last five years.

question_sentence: The Nasa mission that will return humans to the Moon for the first time in 50 years had to be postponed this week minutes before launch. What’s the name of the mission?
evidence: The first mission in the Artemis programme failed to launch after an engine cooling problem was identified. A second launch attempt will take place this weekend.

question_sentence: A letter made public this week revealed which Victorian author had campaigned for postal deliveries in their village to take place on Sundays?
evidence: The letter is now on display at the Charles Dickens Museum in London, and is one of 144 pieces of correspondence to have been added to the collection.

question_sentence: Donald Trump boasted he had “intelligence” on the sex life of which world leader, according to Rolling Stone magazine?
evidence: The magazine reported that the former US president claimed he had acquired illicit details of Macron’s “naughty ways” through “intelligence” he had seen or been briefed on.

question_sentence: This week marked the 25th anniversary of Princess Diana’s death. How many people lined the streets of London on the day of her funeral in 1997?
evidence: Unprecedented displays of public mourning were seen following Diana’s death, and 2.5 billion people worldwide reportedly tuned in to watch her funeral on TV.

question_sentence: Tory leadership frontrunner Liz Truss has said that the UK’s “experiment” with what hasn’t worked?
evidence: The leadership hopeful pledged to “review them and stop them, if they’re not working, as soon as possible” if she becomes the UK’s next prime minister on Monday.

question_sentence: The UK is facing a shortage of which festive crop?
evidence: The UK is facing a shortage of pumpkins as growers warn that poor weather has reduced their harvest by as much as a third. Experts said there will be a shortage of pumpkins for Halloween.

question_sentence: What is the estimated cost of the damage caused by devastating floods in Pakistan?
evidence: The planning minister in Pakistan said early estimates showed that flooding has caused at least $10bn (£8.5bn) worth of damage.
